review: Chromecast has expanded my options for TV and secured my total abandonment of paid providers  is cable OE satellite.  I live in an area of VT with 1 NH PBS station and 1VT PBS station and only NBC over the air.  So streaming via free apps or low cost apps like acorn TV for the British shows I prefer is a real plus.  For Acorn TV I added the web video caster app and have all the programming I choose without the mind-numbing junk ballooned on paid providers.  Thanks a bunch Google.  I ended up buying another Chromecast for the bedroom.  I really appreciate the fact that my tablet or laptop can power off or be used for other applications once the Chromecast video begins.My only concern is that some TVs do not disable the USB port when the TV is turned off.  That means the Chromecast is always powered on (and warm to the touch.). So for the TV that keeps power to the USB port, I simply unplug the Chromecast from that USB port while keeping the device attached to the HDMI port.
